info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 2:41PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A CLUSTER OF THUNDERSTORMS WITH HEAVY RAINFALL WILL IMPACT WESTERN CABARRUS AND CENTRAL MECKLENBURG COUNTIES UNTIL 315 PM EDT... At 240 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the leading edge of a cluster of thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Huntersville to near Uptown Charlotte to 11 miles northwest of Indian Land, and moving east at 20 mph. Locations to be impacted include... Charlotte, Concord, and Harrisburg. Very heavy rainfall rates up to 2 inches per hour will be possible in these areas.
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
